summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between law enforcement officials (NYPD/FBI Task Force and a US Attorney's Office) discussing plans to interview a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. The individual's daughter stated he is represented by attorney Aitan Gohlman and prefers communications through him.

persons.name: Aitan Gohlman
persons.context: Identified as the attorney representing a former Epstein employee whom law enforcement is attempting to interview. All communications are to go through him.

connections.description: Aitan Gohlman is the attorney representing the former Epstein employee, as stated by the employee's daughter to law enforcement.
The subject of the interview is described as a former employer of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Law enforcement attempts interview at residence
events.description: Law enforcement officers knocked on the door of a former Epstein employee to request an interview about Epstein. The employee's daughter answered, translated, and directed them to his attorney.

keyFacts: In October 2020, law enforcement was actively seeking to interview a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein as part of their investigation.
The former employee's daughter acted as a translator and informed agents that her father is represented by attorney Aitan Gohlman.
The communication shows coordination between the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and the US Attorney's Office regarding investigative interviews.
